ygData.subject: Re: starting smithing
ygData.msgSnippet: I think he meant to say that SKEWERS were last and go up to 115... Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild -
ygData.messageBody:
I think he meant to say that SKEWERS were last and go up to 115...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com



----- Original Message -----
From: lost One <l0st1@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, September 10, 1999 1:46 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] starting smithing


> From: "lost One" <l0st1@...>
>
> Find some ore, and make some metal bits. Say four stacks worth, as you
will fail a few times making these. Make some scalers with the bits, then
make more bits. Once bits become trivial, make a full backpack or two of
them. This is major carpal tunnel syndrom time, but it's necessary to do.
Keep making scalers until trivial. Move on to lanterns, they cost a little
more, but you fail a lot less, and don't lose much money. Scalers are last
until your skill hits 115, then you can try pots to 125(?) then sewing kits.
Although I found that pots and sewing kits don't give you very much skill.
Once you hit 125 in skill just sell all armor.
> --
>
> On Tue, 7 Sep 1999 19:45:44 nicolas.miskic wrote:
> >From: nicolas.miskic@...
> >
> >Greeting
> >
> >i play a barbarian shaman lvl 15
> >my int is 61 and my char 88
> >
> >i have recently started blacksmithing and there is my 2 cent.
> >first i have only put 3 point in my skill.
> >I have started by sharpening weapon and surprise ! unlike its
> >always say in the different guide you find about this skill : when
> >you lacked the skill you don t loose both the weapon and the
> >sharpening stone but only the sharpening stone. cost of one
> >sharpening stone 3 copper :)
> >may be its recent patch that have change that ?
> >
> >I also know that it will take you many time to get enought rusty
> >weapon to increase your skill. Well if you check the vendor near
> >you , you will probably find many rusty weapon to sell.
> >
> >Start with the cheapest one: rusty dagger and rusty axe (price
> >around 6 silver). when you sell them back to the vendor you will
> >loose around ... hum, five copper ? And those become trivial at 21
> >skill. : )
> >
> >then use rusty mace until 24.
> >Then use rusty long sword until 26
> >then use rusty two handed sword until ... don 't find enought to
> >know when they become trivial. believe its 27
> >Sure you will loose more money as the price of the weapon
> >increase. up to five silver for each weapon and little more later ...
> >
> >I have bring my skill to 26 like this, using very few plate.
> >
> >Now here are some question.
> >
> >Can anyone give me the cheapest way to increase my skill now?
> >Is it possible to make small brick of ore starting with small piece of
> >ore ?
> >many thanks for your help.
> >
> >GDAOR. Karana server
> >
> >
